availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George T. Hulse (Platte County, Missouri, cashier. )

body.p: Platte County, Missouri, cashier. New York native. Married to Mary B. Van Bibber Hulse in Platte County, Missouri, on June 22, 1842. Father of James W. Hulse. Cashier in Platte County, Missouri in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Platte County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, Platte County, Weston, p. 708.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Missouri, Platte County, Weston, p. 225B.
Missouri, County Marriage, Naturalization, and Court Records (1800-1991), Missouri State Archives, Jefferson City, MO, Film#007514188, Platte County Births/Marriages/Deaths, p. 35.
"George Tuthill Hulse (1810-1893)," Find A Grave, Memorial #157296972, accessed July 19, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/157296972.
